item.title: Writing TCKs with JUnit Jupiter's Dynamic Tests
item.description: When you develop a library that provides some abstraction, or write a spec, it is a good practice to include a TCK (Technology Compatibility Kit) that the implementers can use to verify the behavior of their implementation and how well it matches the spec.
